back_cards.definition_en: A way in which something is done or happens
back_cards.example_en: She answered the question in a confident manner.

back_cards.definition_en: A person's outward behavior or demeanor
back_cards.example_en: His polite manner impressed the interviewer.

back_cards.definition_en: A style or method of doing something
back_cards.example_en: The chef cooked the dish in the traditional Italian manner.

back_cards.definition_en: A customary way of acting in a social setting
back_cards.example_en: Table manners are important at formal dinners.

back_cards.definition_en: A kind or sort of something
back_cards.example_en: What manner of fish is this?

back_cards.definition_en: Feeling shocked or amazed by something unexpected
back_cards.example_en: She was surprised by the sudden rain.

back_cards.definition_en: Caught off guard in a social situation
back_cards.example_en: He looked surprised when his friends threw a party.

back_cards.definition_en: Expressing astonishment at a work achievement
back_cards.example_en: The team was surprised by the project's early completion.

back_cards.definition_en: Reacting to an unusual natural phenomenon
back_cards.example_en: We were surprised by the bright comet in the sky.
I was surprised to hear she changed careers.

back_cards.definition_en: A rate or proportion per hundred
back_cards.example_en: A high percentage of students passed the test.
She received a percentage of the company's profits.
His shooting percentage improved this season.

back_cards.definition_en: A portion of land covered by vegetation
back_cards.example_en: The percentage of green space in the park is low.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a financial transaction
back_cards.example_en: The agent charged a percentage for the house sale.

back_cards.definition_en: Very large in size or amount
back_cards.example_en: The massive tree blocked the road.
The company announced a massive merger.
A massive wave crashed onto the shore.
The concert had a massive turnout of fans.
It was a massive undertaking to rebuild the bridge.

back_cards.definition_en: A visible mass of water droplets in the sky
back_cards.example_en: The cloud covered the sun this afternoon.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphor for confusion or doubt
back_cards.example_en: A cloud of uncertainty hung over the meeting.
She saved her photos to the cloud.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of particles or insects
back_cards.example_en: A cloud of dust rose from the dirt road.
His bad news cast a cloud over the party.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who succeeds in a competition
back_cards.example_en: The winner of the race received a medal.
She felt like a winner after finishing her project.

back_cards.definition_en: A product or idea that gains popularity
back_cards.example_en: This new phone is a winner in the market.

back_cards.definition_en: A person admired in a social group
back_cards.example_en: His kind attitude made him a winner among friends.

back_cards.definition_en: A team that triumphs in sports
back_cards.example_en: The winners celebrated their championship victory.
She gave an honest answer to the question.
The shopkeeper was honest about the product's flaws.
His honest smile warmed the room.
I appreciate your honest feedback on my work.
He lived an honest life, helping others.

back_cards.definition_en: A level of quality or achievement
back_cards.example_en: The product met the industry standard.
The company follows strict safety standards.
This is the standard size for a coffee cup.

back_cards.definition_en: A flag or symbol in history
back_cards.example_en: The army raised its standard on the hill.
Politeness is a standard in formal settings.

back_cards.definition_en: To suggest a plan or idea
back_cards.example_en: She proposed a new strategy for the team.
He proposed to his girlfriend at sunset.
They proposed building a new park.

back_cards.definition_en: To nominate someone for a role
back_cards.example_en: I propose John for the committee chair.
We propose to finish the project by Friday.

back_cards.definition_en: To depend on something or someone
back_cards.example_en: I rely on my phone for directions.
The team relies on her expertise.
The village relies on the river for water.

back_cards.definition_en: To depend on support in tough times
back_cards.example_en: He relies on friends during stress.
We rely on data to make choices.
The meal costs ten dollars plus tax.
Her experience is a big plus for the team.
The package includes a phone plus accessories.
The location is a plus for our event.
This model comes with a camera plus zoom.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of words expressing a complete thought
back_cards.example_en: She wrote a clear sentence in her essay.

back_cards.definition_en: A punishment given by a court
back_cards.example_en: The judge issued a five-year sentence.
The teacher explained sentence structure.
His sentence surprised everyone at the table.
The novel's first sentence was captivating.

back_cards.definition_en: An act of asking for something
back_cards.example_en: She made a request for more time.
The client sent a request for a quote.
His request was to sit by the window.

back_cards.definition_en: A call for help in emergencies
back_cards.example_en: The village sent a request for supplies.
The server processed the data request.

back_cards.definition_en: The way someone or something looks
back_cards.example_en: Her appearance changed after the haircut.
His appearance at the party was unexpected.
The mountain's appearance was stunning.
The band made an appearance on TV.
Don't judge by appearance alone.
She called regarding the job opening.
He wrote a memo regarding safety rules.
Questions regarding the project were raised.
Details regarding the wedding were shared.
The email was regarding our next steps.
The restaurant served excellent food.
She did an excellent job on the report.
The view from the hill was excellent.
He has excellent manners at parties.
Her grades this semester are excellent.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who has committed a crime
back_cards.example_en: The police arrested the criminal.

back_cards.definition_en: A character in a legal context
back_cards.example_en: The lawyer defended the criminal in court.

back_cards.definition_en: A figure in a crime story
back_cards.example_en: The novel's criminal was clever.
Neglecting the issue was criminal.

back_cards.definition_en: A person breaking rules in society
back_cards.example_en: The criminal ignored traffic laws.

back_cards.definition_en: A mineral used to flavor food
back_cards.example_en: Add a pinch of salt to the soup.
The lab tested the salt's properties.

back_cards.definition_en: A natural resource from the sea
back_cards.example_en: They harvested salt from the ocean.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphor for wisdom or value
back_cards.example_en: He's the salt of the earth.
The recipe calls for salt and pepper.

back_cards.definition_en: The quality of being physically attractive
back_cards.example_en: Her beauty caught everyone's attention.
The beauty of the sunset was breathtaking.
The beauty of her kindness shone through.

back_cards.definition_en: A feature in art or design
back_cards.example_en: The painting captured the beauty of nature.

back_cards.definition_en: A sense of harmony in life
back_cards.example_en: He found beauty in simple moments.
She filled the bottle with water.
He bought a bottle of wine.

back_cards.definition_en: A storage item in daily life
back_cards.example_en: The baby drank from a bottle.
The antique bottle was valuable.
Pack a bottle for the hike.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a larger system
back_cards.example_en: The engine is a key component of the car.
This computer has high-quality components.
Trust is a component of teamwork.
The circuit board has many components.
Water is a component of this paint.

back_cards.definition_en: In a lower position than something
back_cards.example_en: The cat slept under the table.
She works under a strict boss.
The temperature is under freezing.
The bridge is under construction.
The trip took under two hours.
The lawyer charged a high fee.
The gym has a monthly fee.
The concert fee includes parking.
Late returns incur a fee.
The bank added a fee for transfers.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the Jewish people or religion
back_cards.example_en: She attended a Jewish holiday celebration.
The museum displayed Jewish art.
They served Jewish foods at the event.
The book explored Jewish history.
His Jewish heritage was important to him.
Is this book yours or mine?
Yours sincerely, John.
The choice is yours to make.
This seat is yours for the concert.
I like my coffee black; how about yours?
The desert is a dry place.
She prefers dry wine.
The lecture was dry and hard to follow.
Her clothes were dry after the spin cycle.
He gave a dry summary of the facts.

back_cards.definition_en: A series of movements to music
back_cards.example_en: The dance at the wedding was lively.
They attended a dance at the club.
Modern dance is her favorite style.
The festival featured a folk dance.
The leaves did a dance in the wind.

back_cards.definition_en: A garment for the upper body
back_cards.example_en: He wore a blue shirt to work.
She bought a t-shirt for the trip.
The team's shirt had a bold logo.
His shirt was ironed for the interview.
I got him a funny shirt for his birthday.

back_cards.definition_en: A small amount of money given for service
back_cards.example_en: She left a generous tip for the waiter.
He gave me a tip for improving my golf swing.

back_cards.definition_en: The end or point of something
back_cards.example_en: The tip of the pencil broke.
She got a tip about a sale.
The tip of the hat showed respect.

back_cards.definition_en: A synthetic material used in products
back_cards.example_en: The chair is made of plastic.
She paid with plastic instead of cash.
Plastic is used in car parts.
The toy felt like flimsy plastic.
Plastic waste harms marine life.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to India or its people
back_cards.example_en: Indian cuisine is rich in flavors.
She wore an Indian sari to the event.
Indian festivals are colorful.
The book covers Indian independence.
Indian music filled the room.
A mark on the wall needed paint.
Her high mark pleased her grade.
His mark set a new record.
The animal left a mark in the mud.
The campaign hit its fundraising mark.

back_cards.definition_en: A hard structure in the mouth
back_cards.example_en: She brushed her tooth after dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a comb or gear
back_cards.example_en: The gear's tooth was worn down.
The dentist checked for tooth decay.
The law lacks tooth to enforce.
The fairy left a coin for her tooth.
She cooked meat for dinner.
The meat of the book was its argument.
Meat is a staple in his diet.
Reducing meat consumption saves water.
The stew included meat and vegetables.
Work stress kept her up at night.
The bridge handled the storm's stress.
Place stress on the first syllable.
Stress can cause headaches.
Moving is a major stress for families.
Parking here is illegal.
The move was illegal in the game.
The company faced illegal practices.
Illegal dumping harms the park.
Selling that is illegal without a license.

back_cards.definition_en: In a notable or important way
back_cards.example_en: Sales increased significantly this year.
Her speech moved the audience significantly.
The temperature dropped significantly.
He contributed significantly to the project.
The new model is significantly better.

back_cards.definition_en: The second month of the year
back_cards.example_en: February is cold in this town.
Valentine’s Day is in February.
February has 28 days usually.
By February, winter feels long.
Taxes are due after February for some.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of laws governing a nation
back_cards.example_en: The constitution protects free speech.
The club wrote a new constitution.
She has a strong constitution.
The constitution outlines rights.

back_cards.definition_en: An explanation of a word's meaning
back_cards.example_en: The dictionary gave a clear definition.
The project lacked a definition of goals.
Her definition of success was unique.
The teacher asked for a definition.
The definition of gravity was tested.
My uncle took me fishing.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for a close family friend
back_cards.example_en: Uncle John isn't really my uncle.
Uncle told us tales at reunions.
Her uncle taught her to drive.
Uncle hosted the holiday dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: A hard, shiny substance like iron
back_cards.example_en: The bridge is made of metal.
Metal is used in construction.
He loves heavy metal music.
Copper is a type of metal.
The car has a metal frame.
Her new album topped the charts.

back_cards.definition_en: A book for photos or keepsakes
back_cards.example_en: They flipped through the album.
The artist released a digital album.
The album held wedding pictures.
The band’s album was a hit.

back_cards.definition_en: A person's own nature or identity
back_cards.example_en: She focused on her inner self.
Therapy helped her understand her self.
He explored the idea of self.
Self-care is vital for health.
She found peace within her self.
I suppose we’ll suppose it’s true for now.
I suppose you’re right about that.
You’re supposed to call first.
Suppose we took a different route?
Suppose we meet at six?

back_cards.definition_en: A person who provides funds for profit
back_cards.example_en: The investor backed the startup.
Investors watched the stock rise.
She was an investor in the film.
The investor diversified her portfolio.
Investors met to discuss growth.

back_cards.definition_en: The edible part of a plant
back_cards.example_en: She ate a piece of fruit.
Their hard work bore fruit.
The tree was full of fruit.
The salad included fresh fruit.
The market displayed colorful fruit.
The holy site attracted pilgrims.
Her holy intentions inspired others.
The book is considered holy text.
The holy festival united the town.
They sang holy songs at church.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of furniture for work
back_cards.example_en: She sat at her desk to study.
His desk was piled with papers.
Ask at the help desk for info.
The new desk faced the window.
Each student had a small desk.
The eastern sky glowed at dawn.
Eastern philosophy interests her.
The eastern city has old temples.
Eastern spices flavored the dish.
Her eastern accent was distinct.
